content: The "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" defines terms like "Federal land" and "Henderson Redevelopment Agency" in relation to the project site. It also references the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 for definitions of hazardous substances, pollutants, and remedies. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency, responsible for the Three Kids Mine Project Site, is defined as the agency of the City of Henderson, Nevada, authorized to transact business under Nevada law. The map for the project area is dated February 6, 2012. The Responsible Party is a private sector entity approved by the State of Nevada for site assessment and redevelopment. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the State refers to the State of Nevada. The Three Kids Mine Project Site, encompassing 1,262 acres of land, is subject to assessment, remediation, reclamation, and redevelopment. The Secretary of the Interior and the State of Nevada are involved in the land conveyance process as outlined in the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will acquire the Federal land within 90 days if certain conditions are met, paying fair market value determined by appraisal. The fair market value of the Federal land will be determined by an appraisal conducted according to nationally recognized standards. The Secretary will estimate the costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site, following national appraisal standards and not considering historical mining contamination on the Federal land. The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must be based on a comprehensive report approved by the State and prepared according to ASTM International Standard E-2137-06 (2011). The Phase II environmental site assessment must follow ASTM International standards E-1527-05 and E-1903-11. The Secretary will review cost information provided by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, the Responsible Party, and the State to prepare an estimate. If there is a disagreement over the estimate, the parties will jointly select experts to assist in making the final determination of costs. The Secretary will begin the appraisal and cost estimates within 30 days of enacting the Act. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimated remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance under subsection (a) is contingent on the Secretary receiving a written agreement from the State. The conveyance of Federal land is contingent on the Secretary receiving a written notification that a mine remediation and reclamation agreement has been executed between the State and the Responsible Party. The agreement must be an enforceable consent order or agreement administered by the State. The agreement required under subparagraph (A) must be an enforceable consent order or agreement between the State and the Responsible Party. It obligates the Responsible Party to perform remediation and reclamation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site to protect human health and the environment. The agreement must comply with all Federal, State, and local requirements and include provisions determined necessary by the State and the Henderson Redevelopment Agency. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must provide notification to the Secretary within 90 days of the mine remediation agreement's execution to accept conveyance of Federal land. Additionally, there is a 10-year withdrawal period outlined in the Act, subject to valid existing rights. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency is ready to accept the conveyance of Federal land as outlined in the Act, which includes a 10-year withdrawal period from various forms of land use. The Act allows for the relinquishment and revocation of Federal land withdrawals by the Bureau of Reclamation if the land is no longer needed. Existing water conveyance infrastructure and facilities on the Federal land are protected for exclusive use by current rights holders. Rights holders are responsible for water conveyance infrastructure on Federal land constructed by the Bureau of Reclamation. The boundary of the River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern is adjusted to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. Parties are responsible for mine remediation and reclamation agreements after conveyance. After conveyance, the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada are responsible for complying with mine remediation and reclamation agreements. The Act does not affect the Secretary's responsibility to take additional action to protect public health and the environment or modify any laws or the authority of the United States to enforce them. SEC. 7. SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LANDS MANAGEMENT ACT does not apply to land conveyed under this Act, unless it expressly modifies or limits compliance with environmental or public health laws, or the authority of the United States to enforce them.
